intro: Oldenlandia rubioides, commonly known as the redstem spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a prostrate or ascending herb with thin, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and a distinctive spurred corolla. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
